intro: Allantodia yaoshanicola, commonly known as the Yaoshan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, pale blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in forested areas and has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It is a perennial herb that thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
